terms_and_conditions_body:
GLOBAL PAYMENTS SERVICE

This page explains the terms and conditions (the “Terms and Conditions”) on which Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce ( “CIBC”) agrees to offer you the user ( “You” or “Your”) access to the Global Payments Service online platform (the “Online Platform”) on behalf of Ritchie Bros. Auctioneers Incorporated and its affiliates (the “Auction Company”). The Online Platform will assist you in making payments to the Auction Company in a currency other than the currency in which the auction item You purchased is denominated (“Auction Currency”). Please read these Terms and Conditions carefully and print a copy for your records.

By selecting the checkbox indicating You agree to these Terms and Conditions, You acknowledge and agree that You have read and understood the Terms and Conditions and any applicable fees and charges.

  1. CIBC does not act as service provider to You

    CIBC provides payment and foreign exchange solutions to Auction Company, including facilitating payment from You for the Auction Company. In accepting payments for the Auction Company, and providing access to the Online Platform to You on behalf of the Auction Company, CIBC acts as a service provider to the Auction Company – not as a service provider to You. In the event You decide to send a payment to an account owned and/or operated by CIBC for the Auction Company, You irrevocably agree that CIBC may accept and act upon the sole instructions of the Auction Company with respect to such payment.

  2. If you wish to pay auction payments in a currency other than the Auction Currency

    You may use the Online Platform to view a foreign exchange rate on auction payments destined to the Auction Company. The foreign exchange rate is provided by CIBC to the Auction Company. You are not required to use the Online Platform to pay auction payments to the Auction Company. You are at all times entitled to source the Auction Currency from alternate financial institutions, including Your local financial institution. CIBC earns income from the difference (the spread) between the prices at which we buy and sell foreign currency. Our spreads may differ from time and can change (without prior notice). This spread is reflected in the Quote (defined below) and will be shared between CIBC and the Auction Company.

  3. How to make an auction payment

    You will be required to follow the below process:

    1. The Online Platform will prompt You to enter the auction payment amount in the Auction Currency, and You will select Your preferred currency.

    2. The Online Platform will display a quote (the “Quote”) in Your selected currency, which quote will remain valid for 6 days (excluding those hours between 12:01 a.m. on a Saturday and 11:59 p.m. on a Sunday in your local time and Canadian statutory holidays) (the “Deadline”) and will present the proposed exchange rate for the relevant currency pair. During a 6 day period (excluding those hours between 12:01 a.m. on a Saturday and 11:59 p.m. on a Sunday in your local time and Canadian statutory holidays), you will not be able to access the Online Platform to view further Quotes for that invoice.

    3. You will be required to confirm the following information:

      1. Customer Information:

        • Customer Reference Number
        • Bidder ID
        • Legal Surname
        • Legal First Name
        • Payment Amount

      2. Payor information (if different from the customer information above):

        • Name
        • Address
        • Contact details, including email address

      3. Payor local bank information:

        • Account Number
        • Bank Name
        • Address
        • Contact details

      You are solely responsible for the accuracy and completeness of Your information. You acknowledge and understand that Your failure to provide and maintain accurate information via the Online Platform may result in a delayed or returned payment(s).

    4. The Online Platform will generate wire instructions. You are required to present the wire instructions to Your local bank as soon as possible to initiate the wire transfer.

    5. You must ensure that the wire transfer is received prior to the Deadline or Your payment may be returned. If You are unable to make the payment in time, Your continued access to the Online Platform will be at the Auction Company’s discretion. You are therefore advised to make sure that You will have time to go to your local bank as soon as possible after obtaining a Quote from the Online Platform. Unless Your payment is subject to a return or refund as described below in section 4, payment in your preferred currency in accordance with the wire instructions will be accepted by the Auction Company in satisfaction of the amounts owing to the Auction Company in the Auction Currency.

  4. Returns and Refunds

    If, for whatever reason, the auction payment is returned to You, CIBC (on behalf of the Auction Company) will reconvert the payment at the then-prevailing foreign exchange rate for the relevant currency pair. Neither the Auction Company nor CIBC shall be responsible for any resulting losses or costs incurred by You, including without limitation any foreign exchange losses (due to fluctuations in foreign currency pricing) and any intermediary bank charges or fees.

    1. Refunds: CIBC does not have authority to reverse or refund authorized transactions. You must contact the Auction Company directly for a refund or reversal.

    2. Returns: CIBC on behalf of the Auction Company may return a payment to You if so requested by the Auction Company or for one of the following reasons:

      1. The wire transfer contains incorrect information or is missing required information;

      2. The amount received by Auction Company is less than the expected amount for whatever reason

      3. iii. if the payment is not received by Auction Company within 6 days (excluding those hours between 12:01 a.m. on a Saturday and 11:59 p.m. on a Sunday in your local time and statutory holidays) of the Online Platform displaying the Quote, or

      4. if so required by applicable (i) anti-money laundering legislation and/or (ii) international sanctions, including without limitation economic, financial or trade sanctions (collectively, “AML Requirements”).

    Neither the Auction Company, nor CIBC will have any liability for any costs or losses incurred by You resulting from any action taken by CIBC or the Auction Company in furtherance of compliance with AML Requirements.

  5. Intellectual Property

    You acknowledge and agree that all copyright and other intellectual property rights in and to the Online Platform are and remain CIBC’s exclusive property. You agree not to permit use of the Online Platform by any third party. You agree to not directly or indirectly, decompile, disassemble, reverse engineer or otherwise attempt to derive or discern the source code or internal workings of the Online Platform.

  6. Indemnity

    You agree to indemnify, defend and hold CIBC and the Auction Company; and their respective subsidiaries, affiliates, officers, employees and agents harmless from any claim or demand, including legal fees and expenses, (a) in connection with or related to any inaccurate information provided by You, or (b) arising out of Your (i) unlawful or negligent use of the Online Platform; (ii) intentional misuse of the Online Platform; (iii) breach of the Terms and Conditions, or (iv) any legal proceedings commenced by You against CIBC or the Auction Company in connection with any claim that has been either disclaimed or limited hereunder.

  7. Disclaimer

    YOU UNDERSTAND AND AGREE THAT THE ONLINE PLATFORM IS PROVIDED ON AN "AS IS" AND “AS AVAILABLE” BASIS. AUCTION COMPANY AND CIBC MAKE NO WARRANTY THAT THE ONLINE PLATFORM WILL MEET YOUR REQUIREMENTS OR THAT USE OF THE ONLINE PLATFORM WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED, TIMELY, SECURE OR ERROR FREE; NOR DOES AUCTION COMPANY AND CIBC MAKE ANY WARRANTY AS TO THE RESULTS THAT MAY BE OBTAINED FROM USE OF THE ONLINE PLATFORM OR THE ACCURACY OR RELIABILITY OF ANY INFORMATION OBTAINED THROUGH THE ONLINE PLATFORM. AUCTION COMPANY AND CIBC DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, WHETHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY REGARDING THE ONLINE PLATFORM, INCLUDING ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, QUIET ENJOYMENT, TITLE, NON-INFRINGEMENT OF THIRD PARTY RIGHTS AND ACCURACY OF DATA. AUCTION COMPANY AND CIBC ARE NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY LOSS OR DAMAGE TO A MOBILE DEVICE RESULTING FROM YOUR ACCESS OR USE OR ATTEMPTED USE OF THE ONLINE PLATFORM. AUCTION COMPANY AND CIBC MAY, WITHOUT NOTICE, SUSPEND ANY PART OR ALL OF THE ONLINE PLATFORM IN ORDER TO REDUCE OR PREVENT FRAUD, IF REQUIRED BY LAW, IN ORDER FOR EMERGENCY MAINTENANCE OR REPAIRS TO BE CARRIED OUT, OR IF IT SO CHOOSES.

  8. No Liability for Use of Site

    Auction Company and CIBC will only be liable to You for direct damages that are finally judicially determined to have resulted from their respective gross negligence, fraud or willful misconduct. AUCTION COMPANY AND CIBC WILL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGES, LOSSES OR EXPENSES (INCLUDING DIRECT, INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES) ARISING FROM THE INABILITY TO USE THIS SITE OR THE SITE INFORMATION, OR AN ERROR, OMISSION, INTERRUPTION, DEFECT, DELAY, COMPUTER VIRUS, SYSTEM FAILURE, LOSS OF DATA OR OTHERWISE, EVEN IF AUCTION COMPANY AND CIBC OR THEIR RESPECTIVE REPRESENTATIVES ARE ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES, LOSSES OF EXPENSES. These limitations apply to any act or omission of us or our employees, officers, directors, affiliates, agents or suppliers, including any negligent acts or omissions of such persons, and to any losses resulting from such act or omission, even if we were advised of the possibility of damages, regardless of the form or the basis of action, including a cause of action in contract, tort (including negligence), statute or any other doctrine of law.

  9. Privacy and Data Confidentiality

    You consent to the collection, use and sharing of your personal information as described in CIBC’s privacy policy Your Privacy is Protected. This includes collecting information about You from, and sharing it with, the Auction Company, its affiliates and other such parties as may reasonably be required for the purposes of (i) providing You access to and use of the Global Payments Service ; (ii) allowing CIBC to provide payment and foreign exchange solutions to your Auction Company, including facilitating payments from and returns to You for the Auction Company, to assist in addressing services enquiries and disputes related to Your use of the Global Payments Service, and providing reports to the Auction Company on such services; (iii) identifying You; (iv) verifying information You give CIBC; (v) protecting You and CIBC from errors and criminal activity; and (vi) complying with legal and regulatory obligations. CIBC may communicate with You for any of these purposes by phone, fax, text, or other electronic means, and automatic dialing-announcing device, at any numbers You have provided CIBC, or Internet, mail, or any other methods.

    CIBC’s privacy policy is available at any branch or www.cibc.com. This policy may be amended, replaced or supplemented from time to time. The CIBC Group includes CIBC and its Canadian affiliates that offer deposits, loans, mutual funds, securities trading, portfolio management, investment counseling, mortgages, credit cards, trust services, insurance, and other products and services.

  10. Governing Law

    This site and Your use of the Online Platform will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Province of Ontario and the federal laws of Canada applicable therein, without regard to the principles of conflicts of law. Any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with Your use of the Online Platform will be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Ontario, Canada.

  11. Compliance with Laws

    You agree to comply with all applicable federal, state, provincial and local laws, regulations, ordinances and codes.
faq_sub_title: Ritchie Bros. Financial Services Currency Exchange Platform:
faq_body:
Q. What are my benefits to use this method of payment?

A. This method allows you to make the payments in your preferred currency. Other benefits include:

  • The quote is valid for 6 business days (excluding weekends and Canadian holidays) to give you peace of mind against any adverse currency price fluctuations.
  • The platform allows you to monitor your payments and notifies when the payment is received.
  • The transaction flows through in a fully secure banking environment.
  • Faster processing times and transfer to client account.

Q. Can I pay in any other currency other than my preferred currency?

A. Yes. You have a choice to make payments in your preferred currency or another supported currency.

Q. Why do I have to make a payment within 6 business days?

A. The Foreign Exchange market is dynamic and prices are changing continuously. To protect from this volatility, we are able to offer protection for a period of 6 business days, not including weekends and Canadian holidays. 

Q. What happens if I make a payment after 6 business days?

A. Any payment made after the 6 business days deadline may be returned. The quote expires after the 6 business days window, and we may not be able to process your payment. It could result in additional costs to you. For any questions regarding the transaction please feel free to contact us 1.800.211.3983. (US & Canada) or +1 778.331.5939 (international).

Q. Why is my currency not available?

A. Unfortunately, there are some currencies that are not supported due to banking regulations, sanctions or other reasons. To help clients in such cases, we provide the option to make the payments in USD Dollars.

Q. What if some information was missed by the local bank when transferring the funds?

A. Please contact us immediately at 1.800.211.3983. (US & Canada) or +1 778.331.5939 (international) and provide the information. Please ensure you have mentioned the following information in your communication:
  • GPS Payment Item
  • Bidder ID
  • Invoice #
  • Auction Name
  • Date
  • Payment Amount

Q. My local bank is not allowing me to make the payment?

A. The local bank should transfer the funds to the account and in the currency the client has requested in. Please contact us immediately at 1.800.211.3983. (US & Canada) or +1 778.331.5939 (international).

Q. I lost my instructions sheet, how can I get a copy of the same?

A. Please log into the GPS portal, click on transactions to print your instruction sheet. Alternatively, please contact us at 1.800.211.3983. (US & Canada) or +1 778.331.5939 (international) requesting the same

Q. How will I know when my funds are received?

A. We shall send you an email notification advising of receipt of payment.

Q. My local bank is charging a fee to send money, is that covered in your fees?

A. No, local bank charges are not covered under the quote provided. Please send the quoted amount in full, and pay any additional fees directly to your local bank.

Q. I made a mistake and need to correct information I entered in the portal?

A. Please contact us immediately at 1.800.211.3983. (US & Canada) or +1 778.331.5939 (international). We shall try and correct the information from our end. Please ensure you have mentioned the following information in your communication:
  • GPS Payment Item
  • Bidder ID
  • Invoice #
  • Auction Name, Date
  • Payment Amount

pay_flow_proceed_to_payment_label_f70: Details of payment (your reference code is RBAASG / RBA-XXXXXXX-A)
pay_flow_proceed_to_payment_instructions: What you need to make the payment
pay_flow_proceed_to_payment_description:
Your payment is due on {{dueDate}} 4:30 PM EST.

Next steps:

  1. Please print and take the payment instruction sheet to your bank. The account listed below is different than the RBA account listed on your invoice. The instructions have also been emailed to you.
    The exchange rate secured requires funds to be remitted according the instructions below. Funds should not be wired to any other RBA account. It may result in shortages from incorrect remittance that will be the responsibility of the Payer. It can also cause a delay in processing in your payment and releasing your item(s).
  2. Confirm with your bank that the reference code is included in the payment details sent.
  3. Keep a receipt of the bank transaction for your records. 

If you're a European resident, you can send us an international bank transfer using the name, address, SWIFT code and account number below. Please make sure that you include your reference code in the details.
